any one knows abt audio MIME type registration
what are you looking for exactly ? adding/editing mime-type associations ?
i find assogiate a very nice tool for that
ok, assogiate is in the regular ubuntu repo's, so either install via synaptic or "sudo apt)get install assogiate"
it's very straightforward .. it presents you with a categorzed list of all system/user registered mime-types and an editing pane :)
one note, if you need to change system mime-types, assogiate like any other GUI app will need to be started via "gksu", that bit me a few times ;)
no, audio players need codecs for them to be able to play those mime-types
what type of audio file are you trying to get to play in which player ?
ok, and what player doesn't work right now for you with wav's ?
ow i see, wav should be supported in all major browsers i guess
might be wise to check the mplayer website and forums if you haven't already, can't help you on that sorry
if you need wav support in firefox, install mozilla-mplayer package and restart your firefox
